content: Can you provide an example of HTML code to display a tree-like structure?

Certainly! To display a tree-like structure using HTML, you can use a combination of nested lists (`
    ` and `
  • `) to represent the hierarchical nature of a tree. Here's a simple example of how you might structure an HTML document to display a tree: ```html Tree Structure Example

    Tree Structure Example

    • Root
      • Branch 1
        • Leaf 1.1
        • Leaf 1.2
      • Branch 2
        • Leaf 2.1
        • Leaf 2.2
          • Leaf 2.2.1
    ``` ### Explanation: - **`
      `**: An unordered list that can be nested to represent branches of the tree. - **`
    • `**: List items that represent nodes in the tree, such as branches or leaves. - **CSS**: This example uses basic CSS to remove default bullets and provide custom styling. This is a simple static representation. For interactive or dynamic tree structures, you might use JavaScript libraries such as D3.js or jQuery plugins to enhance functionality.
